dt: {bc}the art of attack and defense with the fists practiced as a sport

shortdef: the art of attack and defense with the fists practiced as a sport

dt: {bc}an act of enclosing in a box

shortdef: an act of enclosing in a box
material used for boxes and casings

dt: {bc}to enclose in or as if in a box
{bc}to hem in (someone, such as an opponent)

shortdef: to enclose in or as if in a box
to hem in (someone, such as an opponent) —usually used with in, out, or up

dt: {bc}to fight with the fists {bc}engage in boxing
{bc}to hit (something, especially someone's ears) with the hand

shortdef: to fight with the fists : engage in boxing
to hit (something, especially someone's ears) with the hand

dt: {bc}to name the 32 points of (the compass) in their order
used figuratively in the phrase {it}box the compass{/it} to describe making a complete reversal

et: probably from Spanish {it}bojar{/it} to circumnavigate, from Catalan {it}vogir{/it} to turn, from Latin {it}volvere{/it} to roll {ma}{mat|voluble|}{/ma}
shortdef: to name the 32 points of (the compass) in their order —used figuratively in the phrase box the compass to describe making a complete reversal

dt: {bc}the first weekday after Christmas observed as a legal holiday in parts of the Commonwealth of Nations and marked by the giving of Christmas boxes to service workers (such as postal workers)

shortdef: the first weekday after Christmas observed as a legal holiday in parts of the Commonwealth of Nations and marked by the giving of Christmas boxes to service workers (such as postal workers)

dt: {bc}one of a pair of leather mittens heavily padded on the back and worn in boxing

shortdef: one of a pair of leather mittens heavily padded on the back and worn in boxing

dt: {bc}to surround (someone or something) and make movement difficult

dt.t: The other bicyclists {it}boxed{/it} her {it}in{/it} and she couldn't move ahead.
We {it}were boxed in{/it} and couldn't get out of our parking space.
I feel {it}boxed in{/it} by all these rules.

shortdef: to surround (someone or something) and make movement difficult —usually used as (be) boxed in —sometimes used figuratively
